       The   City Journal             
          (USPS: 114-540)             
         Published Weekly             
        Under Authority of            
    City Ordinance No. 30050          
        by City of St. Louis          
      Parrie L. May, Register         
         1206 Market Street           
         Room 118 City Hall           
     St. Louis, Missouri 63103        
 Yearly Subscription . . . . $30.00   
         IN ADVANCE                   
 Copies for sale and distribution at  
       Room 118 City Hall             
     Periodicals postage paid at      
         St. Louis, Missouri          
Postmaster: send address              
changes to City Journal, Register's   
Office. 1206 Market Street, Room      
118, St. Louis, Missouri, 63103.      
      JOURNAL                     
       OF THE                     
  Board of                        
  Aldermen                        
      OF THE                      
 CITY OF ST. LOUIS                
      REGULAR                     
       SESSION                    
      2004-2005                   
 PRELIMINARY                      
 The following is a preliminary   
  draft of the minutes of the     
           meeting of             
    FRIDAY, MAY 14, 2004.         
     These minutes are            
   unofficial and subject to      
    Aldermanic approval.          
     City of St. Louis Board of Aldermen         
 Chambers, May 14, 2004.                         
      The roll was called and the following      
 Aldermen answered to their names: Smith,        
 Flowers, Bosley, Ryan, Ford-Griffin, Reed,      
 Young, Conway, Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa,         
 Heitert, Wessels, Gregali, Florida, Baringer,   
 Roddy, Kennedy, McMillan, Schmid, Jones-        
 King, Boyd, Bauer, Williamson, Carter,          
 Krewson and Mr. President Shrewsbury. 27        
      "Almighty God, source of all authority,    
 we humbly ask guidance in our deliberations     
 and wisdom in our conclusions.                  
      ANNOUNCEMENT OF ANY                        
    SPECIAL ORDER OF THE DAY                     
     Ms. Krewson of the Rules & Regulations      
 Committee submitted the following report        
 which was read.                                 
      To the President of the Board of           
 Aldermen and Aldermen:                          
       The Committee on Rules and                
 Regulations has met and report that they have   
 considered the qualifications of the following  
 individual and find she is qualified to hold the
 office of Alderwoman:                           
 Kathleen Hanrahan.                              
       Ms. Krewson moved to adopt the report     
 of the Rules & Regulations Committee.           
      Seconded by Ms. Young.                     
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.         
      Alderwoman elect Hanrahan sworn in         
 by the City Register Parrie May.                
     The roll was called and the following     
Aldermen answered to their names: Smith,       
Flowers, Bosley, Ryan, Ford-Griffin, Reed,     
Young, Conway, Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa,        
Heitert, Wessels, Gregali, Florida, Baringer,  
Kennedy, McMillan, Schmid, Jones-King,         
Boyd, Hanrahan, Bauer, Williamson, Carter,     
Krewson and Mr. President Shrewsbury. 27       
         INTRODUCTION OF                       
          HONORED GUEST                        
     None.                                     
      APPROVAL OF MINUTES                      
      OF PREVIOUS MEETING                      
    Mr. Wessels moved to approve the           
minutes for April 30, 2004.                    
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                    
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.        
    REPORT OF CITY OFFICIALS                   
       Report of the Clerk of                  
      the Board of Aldermen                    
     None.                                     
         Office of the Mayor                   
Room 200 City Hall                             
1200 Market Street                             
St. Louis, Missouri 63103                      
(314) 622-3201                                 
Fax (314) 622-4061                             
Honorable Board of Aldermen                    
Room 230 City Hall                             
St. Louis, Missouri 63103                      
Dear Members of the Board:                     
    I have returned to the Board B.B. #428     
which I have vetoed.                           
     Sincerely,                                
     FRANCIS G. SLAY                           
     Mayor                                     
     City of St. Louis                         
Room 200 City Hall                             
1200 Market Street                             
St. Louis, Missouri 63103                      
(314) 622-3201                                 
Fax (314) 622-4061                             
May 10, 2004                                   
Honorable Board of Aldermen                    
Room 230 City Hall                             
St. Louis, Missouri 63103                      
Dear Members of the Board:                     
     I have the pleasure to submit to your     
Honorable Board the following individuals for  
reappointment to the Westminster/Lake          
Special Business District:                     
      The reappointment of Mr. Tom Shrout,     
who resides at 5056 Westminster Place,         
63108, and who will represent the owners of    
real property in the District. His term will   
expire on December 31, 2007.                   
       The reappointment of Ann Kittlaus, who        
 resides at 5281 Westminster, 63108, and who         
 will represent the owners of real property in       
 the Distrit. Her term will expire on                
 December 31, 2007.                                  
      May I ask for your Honorable Board's           
 favorable consideration of these                    
 appointments.                                       
       Sincerely,                                    
       FRANCIS G. SLAY                               
       Mayor                                         
       City of St. Louis                             
      Ms. Krewson moved to approve the               
 appointment of Tom Shrout and Ann Kittlaus          
 to the Westminster/Lake Special Business            
 District.                                           
       Seconded by Mr. Gregali                       
       Approved unanimously by voice vote.           
 Petitions & Communications                          
       None.                                         
  BOARD BILLS FOR PERFECTION                         
     - INFORMAL CALENDAR                             
       None.                                         
           BOARD BILLS FOR                           
            THIRD READING                            
        - INFORMAL CALENDAR                          
       None.                                         
             FIRST READING                           
             OF BOARD BILLS                          
 Board Member Florida introduced by                  
 request:                                            
             Board Bill No. 61                       
        An ordinance approving a redevelopment       
 plan for the 4012 Juniata Street Area ("Area")      
 after finding that the Area is blighted as defined  
 in Section 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of        
 Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the "Statute"          
 being Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),         
 containing a description of the boundaries of       
 said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),        
 attached hereto and incorporated herein as          
 Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and         
 rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of    
 the public health, safety, morals and general       
 welfare of the people of the City; approving        
 the Blighting Study and Plan dated February         
 24, 2004 for the Area ("Plan"), incorporated        
 herein by attached Exhibit "B", pursuant to         
 Section 99.430; finding that there is a feasible    
 financial plan for the redevelopment of the         
 Area which affords maximum opportunity for          
 redevelopment of the Area by private                
 enterprise; finding that no property in the Area    
 may be acquired by the Land Clearance for           
 Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.          
 Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of              
 eminent domain; finding that the property           
 within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should   
 become occupied the Redeveloper shall be          
 responsible for relocating any eligible           
 occupants displaced as a result of                
 implementation of the Plan; finding that          
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the      
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with         
 the Plan; finding that there shall be available   
 ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and      
 pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board       
 of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various      
 officials, departments, boards and agencies of    
 the City to cooperate and to exercise their       
 respective powers in a manner consistent with     
 the Plan.                                         
 Board Member Kennedy introduced by                
 request:                                          
             Board Bill No. 62                     
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment      
 plan for the 4200-66 & 4201-89 Olive St. and      
 501 N. Whittier St. Area ("Area") after finding   
 that the Area is blighted as defined in Section   
 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of Missouri,       
 2000, as amended, (the "Statute" being            
 Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),             
 containing a description of the boundaries of     
 said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),      
 attached hereto and incorporated herein as        
 Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and       
 rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of  
 the public health, safety, morals and general     
 welfare of the people of the City; approving      
 the Blighting Study and Plan dated April 27,      
 2004 for the Area ("Plan"), incorporated herein   
 by attached Exhibit "B", pursuant to Section      
 99.430; finding that there is a feasible financial
 plan for the redevelopment of the Area which      
 affords maximum opportunity for                   
 redevelopment of the Area by private              
 enterprise; finding that no property in the Area  
 may be acquired by the Land Clearance for         
 Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.        
 Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of            
 eminent domain; finding that the property         
 within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should   
 become occupied the Redeveloper shall be          
 responsible for relocating any eligible           
 occupants displaced as a result of                
 implementation of the Plan; finding that          
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the      
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with         
 the Plan; finding that the abatement of the       
 public nuisance within the Area is reasonably     
 anticipated to remediate blighting conditions     
 and will serve a public purpose and               
 authorizing the LCRA to contract with the         
 Redeveloper for such abatement; and pledging      
 cooperation of the St. Louis Board of Aldermen    
 ("Board") and requesting various officials,       
 departments, boards and agencies of the City      
 to cooperate and to exercise their respective     
 powers in a manner consistent with the Plan.      
Board Member Ortmann introduced by                  
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 63                       
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment       
plan for the 2116-18 Cherokee Street Area           
("Area") after finding that the Area is blighted    
as defined in Section 99.320 of the Revised         
Statutes of Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the        
"Statute" being Sections 99.300 to 99.715           
inclusive), containing a description of the         
boundaries of said Area in the City of St. Louis    
("City"), attached hereto and incorporated          
herein as Exhibit "A", finding that                 
redevelopment and rehabilitation of the Area        
is in the interest of the public health, safety,    
morals and general welfare of the people of         
the City; approving the Blighting Study and         
Plan dated February 24, 2004 for the Area           
("Plan"), incorporated herein by attached           
Exhibit "B", pursuant to Section 99.430;            
finding that there is a feasible financial plan     
for the redevelopment of the Area which             
affords maximum opportunity for                     
redevelopment of the Area by private                
enterprise; finding that no property in the Area    
may be acquired by the Land Clearance for           
Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.          
Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of              
eminent domain; finding that the property           
within the Area is occupied and the                 
Redeveloper shall be responsible for relocating     
any eligible occupants displaced as a result of     
implementation of the Plan; finding that            
financial aid may be necessary to enable the        
Area to be redeveloped in accordance with           
the Plan; finding that there shall be available     
ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and        
pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board         
of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various        
officials, departments, boards and agencies of      
the City to cooperate and to exercise their         
respective powers in a manner consistent with       
the Plan.                                           
Board Member Ortmann introduced by                  
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 64                       
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment       
plan for the 2216 Sidney Street Area ("Area")       
after finding that the Area is blighted as defined  
in Section 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of        
Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the "Statute"          
being Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),         
containing a description of the boundaries of       
said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),        
attached hereto and incorporated herein as          
Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and         
rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of    
the public health, safety, morals and general       
welfare of the people of the City; approving        
the Blighting Study and Plan dated                  
February 24, 2004 for the Area ("Plan"),            
incorporated herein by attached Exhibit "B",        
 pursuant to Section 99.430; finding that there    
 is a feasible financial plan for the              
 redevelopment of the Area which affords           
 maximum opportunity for redevelopment of          
 the Area by private enterprise; finding that no   
 property in the Area may be acquired by the       
 Land Clearance for Redevelopment Authority        
 of the City of St. Louis ("LCRA") through         
 the exercise of eminent domain; finding that      
 the property within the Area is unoccupied,       
 but if it should become occupied the              
 Redeveloper shall be responsible for relocating   
 any eligible occupants displaced as a result of   
 implementation of the Plan; finding that          
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the      
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with         
 the Plan; finding that there shall be available   
 ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and      
 pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board       
 of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various      
 officials, departments, boards and agencies of    
 the City to cooperate and to exercise their       
 respective powers in a manner consistent with     
 the Plan.                                         
 Board Member Conway introduced by                 
 request:                                          
             Board Bill No. 65                     
        An ordinance approving a redevelopment     
 plan for the 4127-29 Flad Avenue Area             
 ("Area") after finding that the Area is blighted  
 as defined in Section 99.320 of the Revised       
 Statutes of Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the      
 "Statute" being Sections 99.300 to 99.715         
 inclusive), containing a description of the       
 boundaries of said Area in the City of St. Louis  
 ("City"), attached hereto and incorporated        
 herein as Exhibit "A", finding that               
 redevelopment and rehabilitation of the Area      
 is in the interest of the public health, safety,  
 morals and general welfare of the people of       
 the City; approving the Blighting Study and       
 Plan dated February 24, 2004 for the Area         
 ("Plan"), incorporated herein by attached         
 Exhibit "B", pursuant to Section 99.430;          
 finding that there is a feasible financial plan   
 for the redevelopment of the Area which           
 affords maximum opportunity for                   
 redevelopment of the Area by private              
 enterprise; finding that no property in the Area  
 may be acquired by the Land Clearance for         
 Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.        
 Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of            
 eminent domain; finding that the property         
 within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should   
 become occupied the Redeveloper shall be          
 responsible for relocating any eligible           
 occupants displaced as a result of                
 implementation of the Plan; finding that          
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the      
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with         
 the Plan; finding that there shall be available   
 ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and      
 pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board       
 of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various      
 officials, departments, boards and agencies of    
 the City to cooperate and to exercise their       
 respective powers in a manner consistent with     
 the Plan.                                         
 Board Member Villa introduced by request:         
             Board Bill No. 66                     
      An Ordinance recommended by the              
 Planning Commission on May 5, 2004 to             
 change the zoning of property as indicated on     
 the District Map, to the "J" Industrial District, 
 so as to include the described parcels of land    
 in City Block 3077; and containing an             
 emergency clause.                                 
 Board Member Gregali introduced by                
 request:                                          
             Board Bill No. 67                     
      An Ordinance recommended by the              
 Planning Commission on May 5, 2004 to             
 change the zoning of property as indicated on     
 the District Map, to the "F" Area                 
 Neighborhood Commercial District, so as to        
 include the described parcels of land in City     
 Blocks 5646 and 5653; and containing an           
 emergency clause.                                 
 Board Member Young introduced by request:         
             Board Bill No. 68                     
        An ordinance approving a redevelopment     
 plan for the 2741 Accomac Street Area ("Area")    
 after finding that the Area is blighted as defined
 in Section 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of      
 Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the "Statute"        
 being Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),       
 containing a description of the boundaries of     
 said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),      
 attached hereto and incorporated herein as        
 Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and       
 rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of  
 the public health, safety, morals and general     
 welfare of the people of the City; approving      
 the Blighting Study and Plan dated February       
 24, 2004 for the Area ("Plan"), incorporated      
 herein by attached Exhibit "B", pursuant to       
 Section 99.430; finding that there is a feasible  
 financial plan for the redevelopment of the       
 Area which affords maximum opportunity for        
 redevelopment of the Area by private              
 enterprise; finding that no property in the Area  
 may be acquired by the Land Clearance for         
 Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.        
 Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of            
 eminent domain; finding that the property         
 within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should   
 become occupied the Redeveloper shall be          
 responsible for relocating any eligible           
 occupants displaced as a result of                
 implementation of the Plan; finding that          
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the      
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with         
the Plan; finding that there shall be available     
ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and        
pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board         
of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various        
officials, departments, boards and agencies of      
the City to cooperate and to exercise their         
respective powers in a manner consistent with       
the Plan.                                           
Board Member Young introduced by request:           
            Board Bill No. 69                       
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment       
plan for the 1856 Menard Street Area ("Area")       
after finding that the Area is blighted as defined  
in Section 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of        
Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the "Statute"          
being Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),         
containing a description of the boundaries of       
said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),        
attached hereto and incorporated herein as          
Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and         
rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of    
the public health, safety, morals and general       
welfare of the people of the City; approving        
the Blighting Study and Plan dated February         
24, 2004 for the Area ("Plan"), incorporated        
herein by attached Exhibit "B", pursuant to         
Section 99.430; finding that there is a feasible    
financial plan for the redevelopment of the         
Area which affords maximum opportunity for          
redevelopment of the Area by private                
enterprise; finding that no property in the Area    
may be acquired by the Land Clearance for           
Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.          
Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of              
eminent domain; finding that the property           
within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should     
become occupied the Redeveloper shall be            
responsible for relocating any eligible             
occupants displaced as a result of                  
implementation of the Plan; finding that            
financial aid may be necessary to enable the        
Area to be redeveloped in accordance with           
the Plan; finding that there shall be available     
ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and        
pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board         
of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various        
officials, departments, boards and agencies of      
the City to cooperate and to exercise their         
respective powers in a manner consistent with       
the Plan.                                           
Board Member Schmid introduced by                   
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 70                       
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment       
plan for the 3821 Virginia Avenue Area ("Area")     
after finding that the Area is blighted as defined  
in Section 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of        
Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the "Statute"          
being Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),         
containing a description of the boundaries of       
said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),        
 attached hereto and incorporated herein as         
 Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and        
 rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of   
 the public health, safety, morals and general      
 welfare of the people of the City; approving       
 the Blighting Study and Plan dated February        
 24, 2004 for the Area ("Plan"), incorporated       
 herein by attached Exhibit "B", pursuant to        
 Section 99.430; finding that there is a feasible   
 financial plan for the redevelopment of the        
 Area which affords maximum opportunity for         
 redevelopment of the Area by private               
 enterprise; finding that no property in the Area   
 may be acquired by the Land Clearance for          
 Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.         
 Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of             
 eminent domain; finding that the property          
 within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should    
 become occupied the Redeveloper shall be           
 responsible for relocating any eligible            
 occupants displaced as a result of                 
 implementation of the Plan; finding that           
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the       
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with          
 the Plan; finding that there shall be available    
 ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and       
 pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board        
 of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various       
 officials, departments, boards and agencies of     
 the City to cooperate and to exercise their        
 respective powers in a manner consistent with      
 the Plan.                                          
 Board Member Carter introduced by                  
 request:                                           
             Board Bill No. 71                      
       An Ordinance pertaining to the Health        
 Insurance Portability and Accountability Act       
 of 1996, P.L. 104-91 (hereinafter HIPAA);          
 incorporating by reference the definitions of      
 terms set forth in the HIPAA Standards for         
 Privacy of Individually Identifiable Health        
 Information, 45 C.F.R. Part 160 and Part 164,      
 Subparts A and E (the Privacy Rule);               
 providing for compliance by the City with          
 HIPAA as a Hybrid Entity with designation          
 of its Health Care Components under the            
 Privacy Rule and providing for amendment of        
 such designations; designating a City Privacy      
 Officer and Health Care Component Privacy          
 Officers, with their duties, and providing for     
 amendment of such designations; authorizing        
 the Health Care Component Privacy Officers,        
 upon recommendation of the City Counselor          
 and approval of the Board of Estimate and          
 Apportionment, to enter into contracts in          
 furtherance of compliance with the Privacy         
 Rule; ratifying existing contracts, including but  
 not limited to business associate agreements,      
 that the City has entered into to as required      
 by the Privacy Rule; providing for the             
 designation of Business Associate                  
 Components of the Health Care Components           
 and requiring Business Associate Components     
 to meet certain requirements of the Privacy     
 Rule; and providing for a severability clause.  
 Board Members Villa and Boyd introduced         
 by request:                                     
            Board Bill No. 72                    
       An ordinance pertaining to burglary and   
 robbery alarm systems; amending paragraph       
 D of Section Five of Ordinance 66264, for the   
 purpose of removing the requirement of a        
 registration fee for residential and commercial 
 alarm systems.                                  
 Board Member Boyd introduced by request:        
            Board Bill No. 73                    
       An ordinance prohibiting the issuance     
 of any package or drink liquor licenses for     
 any currently non-licensed premises within      
 the boundaries of the Twenty-second Ward        
 Liquor Control District, as established herein, 
 for a period of three years from the effective  
 date hereof; containing an exception allowing,  
 during the moratorium period, for the transfer  
 of existing licenses, under certain             
 circumstances, and the issuance of a drink      
 license to persons operating a restaurant at a  
 previously non-licensed premises; and           
 containing an emergency clause.                 
 Board Member Ortmann introduced by              
 request:                                        
            Board Bill No. 74                    
      An ordinance pertaining to the Liquor      
 Control Law of the City of St. Louis; amending  
 Section Two of Ordinance 66227 setting forth    
 an area which shall no longer be within the     
 convention trade area of the City of St. Louis; 
 containing an emergency clause.                 
 Board Member Conway introduced by               
 request:                                        
            Board Bill No. 75                    
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment    
 plan for the 5342 Magnolia Avenue Area          
 ("Area") after finding that the Area is blighted
 as defined in Section 99.320 of the Revised     
 Statutes of Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the    
 "Statute" being Sections 99.300 to 99.715       
 inclusive), containing a description of the     
 boundaries of said Area in the City of St. Louis
 ("City"), attached hereto and incorporated      
 herein as Exhibit "A", finding that             
 redevelopment and rehabilitation of the Area    
 is in the interest of the public health, safety,
 morals and general welfare of the people of     
 the City; approving the Blighting Study and     
 Plan dated February 24, 2004 for the Area       
 ("Plan"), incorporated herein by attached       
 Exhibit "B", pursuant to Section 99.430;        
 finding that there is a feasible financial plan 
 for the redevelopment of the Area which         
 affords maximum opportunity for                 
redevelopment of the Area by private                
enterprise; finding that no property in the Area    
may be acquired by the Land Clearance for           
Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.          
Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of              
eminent domain; finding that the property           
within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should     
become occupied the Redeveloper shall be            
responsible for relocating any eligible             
occupants displaced as a result of                  
implementation of the Plan; finding that            
financial aid may be necessary to enable the        
Area to be redeveloped in accordance with           
the Plan; finding that there shall be available     
ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and        
pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board         
of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various        
officials, departments, boards and agencies of      
the City to cooperate and to exercise their         
respective powers in a manner consistent with       
the Plan.                                           
Board Member Conway introduced by                   
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 76                       
       An ordinance approving a redevelopment       
plan for the 3835 Flora Place Area ("Area")         
after finding that the Area is blighted as defined  
in Section 99.320 of the Revised Statutes of        
Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the "Statute"          
being Sections 99.300 to 99.715 inclusive),         
containing a description of the boundaries of       
said Area in the City of St. Louis ("City"),        
attached hereto and incorporated herein as          
Exhibit "A", finding that redevelopment and         
rehabilitation of the Area is in the interest of    
the public health, safety, morals and general       
welfare of the people of the City; approving        
the Blighting Study and Plan dated February         
24, 2004 for the Area ("Plan"), incorporated        
herein by attached Exhibit "B", pursuant to         
Section 99.430; finding that there is a feasible    
financial plan for the redevelopment of the         
Area which affords maximum opportunity for          
redevelopment of the Area by private                
enterprise; finding that no property in the Area    
may be acquired by the Land Clearance for           
Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.          
Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of              
eminent domain; finding that the property           
within the Area is unoccupied, but if it should     
become occupied the Redeveloper shall be            
responsible for relocating any eligible             
occupants displaced as a result of                  
implementation of the Plan; finding that            
financial aid may be necessary to enable the        
Area to be redeveloped in accordance with           
the Plan; finding that there shall be available     
five (5) year real estate tax abatement; and        
pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board         
of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various        
officials, departments, boards and agencies of      
the City to cooperate and to exercise their         
 respective powers in a manner consistent with     
 the Plan.                                         
 Board Member Young introduced by request:         
             Board Bill No. 77                     
       An ordinance pertaining to Housing          
 Conservation districts in Ward 7; amending        
 ordinance 60798, approved on April 11, 1988,      
 to change the legal boundaries of the existing    
 Housing Conservation District to include          
 additional parcels within the area known as       
 Bohemian Hills; containing an emergency           
 clause.                                           
 Board Member Jones-King introduced by             
 request:                                          
             Board Bill No. 78                     
        An ordinance approving a redevelopment     
 plan for the 2161 & 4576 E. Fair Avenue Area      
 ("Area") after finding that the Area is blighted  
 as defined in Section 99.320 of the Revised       
 Statutes of Missouri, 2000, as amended, (the      
 "Statute" being Sections 99.300 to 99.715         
 inclusive), containing a description of the       
 boundaries of said Area in the City of St. Louis  
 ("City"), attached hereto and incorporated        
 herein as Exhibit "A", finding that               
 redevelopment and rehabilitation of the Area      
 is in the interest of the public health, safety,  
 morals and general welfare of the people of       
 the City; approving the Blighting Study and       
 Plan dated April 27, 2004 for the Area            
 ("Plan"), incorporated herein by attached         
 Exhibit "B", pursuant to Section 99.430;          
 finding that there is a feasible financial plan   
 for the redevelopment of the Area which           
 affords maximum opportunity for                   
 redevelopment of the Area by private              
 enterprise; finding that no property in the Area  
 may be acquired by the Land Clearance for         
 Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.        
 Louis ("LCRA") through the exercise of            
 eminent domain; finding that the property         
 within the Area is occupied and the               
 Redeveloper shall be responsible for relocating   
 any eligible occupants displaced as a result of   
 implementation of the Plan; finding that          
 financial aid may be necessary to enable the      
 Area to be redeveloped in accordance with         
 the Plan; finding that there shall be available   
 ten (10) year real estate tax abatement; and      
 pledging cooperation of the St. Louis Board       
 of Aldermen ("Board") and requesting various      
 officials, departments, boards and agencies of    
 the City to cooperate and to exercise their       
 respective powers in a manner consistent with     
 the Plan.                                         
 Mr. President Shrewsbury introduced by            
 request:                                          
             Board Bill No. 79                     
      An Ordinance pertaining to the               
 Transportation Sales Tax imposed pursuant         
 to Senate Bill 432 as adopted and approved       
 by the voters of St. Louis City on August 2,     
 1994, pursuant to Ordinance 63168; creating      
 the "City Public Transit Sales Tax Trust         
 Fund" directing the Treasurer of the City of     
 St. Louis to deposit funds received pursuant     
 to said sales tax into the City Public Transit   
 Sales Tax Trust Fund" appropriating NINE         
 MILLION, FIVE HUNDRED, FORTY-                    
 ONE         THOUSAND              DOLLARS        
 ($9,541,000) from the said sales tax for the     
 period herein stated to the Bi-State             
 Development Agency for certain purposes;         
 providing for the payment of such funds          
 during the period July 1, 2004 through, June     
 30, 2005 ; further providing that in no event    
 shall the Comptroller draw warrants on the       
 Treasurer for an amount greater than the         
 amounts of the proceeds deposited in the         
 "City Public Transit Sales Tax Trust Fund"       
 during the period of July 1, 2004 through        
 June 30, 2005 ; containing a severability clause.
 Mr. President Shrewsbury introduced by           
 request:                                         
             Board Bill No. 80                    
      An ordinance appropriating the sum of       
 NINETEEN MILLION, EIGHTY-TWO                     
 THOUSAND DOLLARS ($19,082,000), as               
 described and defined in Section 94.600          
 through 94.655, R.S. Mo. Supp. 1986 as           
 amended for the period herein stated, which      
 sum is hereby appropriated out of the            
 "Transportation Trust Fund" to the Bi-State      
 Development Agency for transportation            
 purposes; and further providing that the         
 appropriation is conditional upon the Bi-State   
 Development Agency supplying the Board           
 of Estimate and Apportionment an annual          
 evaluation report; further providing that in no  
 event shall the Comptroller draw warrants on     
 the Treasurer for an amount greater than the     
 amount of proceeds deposited in the              
 "Transportation Trust Fund" during the           
 period from July 1, 2004 through June 30,        
 2005; providing for the appropriation to be      
 reduced if certain funds are used for other than 
 public transit purposes; further providing that  
 the appropriation is conditional upon Bi-State   
 requiring the payment of prevailing wages and    
 benefits to employees of outside service         
 contractors; and containing a severability       
 clause.                                          
 Mr. President Shrewsbury introduced by           
 request:                                         
             Board Bill No. 81                    
      An ordinance submitting to the qualified    
 voters of the City of St. Louis a proposed       
 amendment to the Charter of the City of St.      
 Louis repealing Paragraphs (d) and (g) of        
 Section Three of Article XVIII of the Charter    
 of the City of St. Louis relating to the         
certification and appointment of eligible           
candidates for city employment and further          
providing for temporary appointments to             
competitive positions within the civil service      
system and enacting in lieu thereof is new          
Paragraphs (d) and (g) for Section Three;           
providing for an election to be held thereon;       
and for the manner of voting thereat and            
containing an emergency clause.                     
Mr. President Shrewsbury introduced by              
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 82                       
      An ordinance submitting to the qualified      
voters of the City of St. Louis a proposed          
amendment to the Charter of the City of St.         
Louis repealing Paragraph (c) of Section Six        
of Article XVIII of the Charter of the City of      
St. Louis relating to the salary for civil service  
commissioners and enacting in lieu thereof is       
a new Paragraph (c) for Section Six; providing      
for an election to be held thereon; and for the     
manner of voting thereat and containing an          
emergency clause.                                   
Mr. President Shrewsbury introduced by              
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 83                       
      An ordinance submitting to the qualified      
voters of the City of St. Louis a proposed          
amendment to the Charter of the City of St.         
Louis repealing Paragraph (h) of Section One        
of Article XVIII of the Charter of the City of      
St. Louis relating to the definition of the term    
"Excepted Position" as it applies to the civil      
service system and enacting in lieu thereof is a    
new Paragraph (h) for Section One; providing        
for an election to be held thereon; and for the     
manner of voting thereat and containing an          
emergency clause.                                   
Board Member McMillan introduced by                 
request:                                            
            Board Bill No. 84                       
      An ordinance authorizing and directing        
the Mayor and Comptroller of the City of St.        
Louis to execute, upon receipt of and in            
consideration of the sum of One Dollar ($1.00)      
and other good and valuable consideration, a        
Quit Claim Deed to remise, release and forever      
quit-claim unto the LAND REUTILIZATION              
AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF ST.                        
LOUIS, MISSOURI, a public corporation,              
created, existing and acting under and by           
authority of the Municipal Land Reutilization       
Law of Missouri, certain City-owned                 
property located in City Blocks 2157, 2158,         
2159, and 2160; which property is known as          
3219 and 3220 Caroline Street, 3313 S.              
Compton Avenue, and 3223 and 3228 Hickory           
Street, and containing an emergency clause.

  SECOND READING AND REPORT                         
    OF STANDING COMMITTEES                          
      Ms. Young of the Committee on                 
 Transportation & Commerce submitted the            
 following report which was read.                   
     Board of Aldermen Committee report,            
 May 14, 2004.                                      
      To the President of the Board of              
 Aldermen:                                          
      The Committee on Transportation &             
 Commerce to whom was referred the                  
 following Board Bills, report that they have       
 considered the same and recommend adoption.        
             Board Bill No. 28                      
       An Ordinance recommended by the              
 Board of Estimate and Apportionment                
 authorizing and directing the Director of          
 Airports and the Comptroller of the City of        
 St. Louis (the "City") to enter into and execute   
 on behalf of the City the "First Amendment         
 To Northern Tract Lease Agreement" at              
 Lambert-St. Louis International Airport(R) (the    
 "Airport") (hereinafter referred to as the "First  
 Amendment") to the Airport Northern Tract          
 Lease Agreement AL-100 between the City            
 and McDonnell Douglas Corporation, a               
 corporation of the State of Maryland, dated        
 December 17, 2001, and authorized by City          
 Ordinance No. 65243, approved                      
 July 18, 2001 (the "Agreement"); the First         
 Amendment to the Agreement, which is               
 attached hereto as ATTACHMENT "1" and              
 made a part hereof, was approved by the            
 City's Airport Commission, and its terms are       
 more fully described in Section One of this     
 Ordinance; providing that the provisions set    
 forth in this Ordinance shall be applicable     
 exclusively to the Agreement as amended by      
 the First Amendment; containing a               
 severability clause; and containing an          
 emergency clause.                               
            Board Bill No. 32                    
       An ordinance pertaining to leases of the  
 public wharf; repealing Ordinance 61755 and     
 enacting in lieu thereof a new ordinance        
 authorizing the Port Authority Commission       
 of the City of St. Louis, within six months     
 prior to the expiration, execution or renewal   
 of any lease on the unimproved wharf, to        
 advertise for proposals on behalf of the City   
 of St. Louis in newspapers, of general          
 circulation, the City Journal and trade journals
 of national publication including but not       
 limited to the Waterway Journal; providing      
 for an exception for any portion of the         
 unimproved public wharf which is subject to     
 the terms and conditions of a lease; and        
 containing an emergency clause.                 
      Alderwoman Young                           
      Chairman of the Committee                  
            REPORT OF                            
        SPECIAL COMMITTEES                       
      None.                                      
 BOARD BILLS FOR PERFECTION                      
       Mr. Conway moved that Board Bill No.      
 39 before the Board for perfection, be          
 perfected as reported out of Committee with     
 its recommendation "Do Pass".                   
      Seconded by Mr. Ortmann.                   
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.         
       Ms. Baringer moved that Board Bill No.    
 40 before the Board for perfection, be          
 perfected as reported out of Committee with     
 its recommendation "Do Pass".                   
      Seconded by Mr. Schmid.                    
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.         
       Mr. Conway moved to suspend the rules     
 for the purpose of moving the following Board   
 Bills to the third reading calendar for final   
 passage: Board Bill Nos. 39 and 40.             
      Seconded by Mr. Villa.                     
      Mr. Bosley moved to place Board Bill       
 No. 39 on the informal calendar.                
      Seconded by Ms. Jones-King.                
     Mr. Bosley withdrew his motion to place     
 Board Bill No. 39 on the informal calendar.     
      Mr. Conway renewed his motion.             
       Motion to suspend the rules carried by    
 the following vote:                             
     Ayes: Smith, Flowers, Bosley, Ryan,         
Ford-Griffin, Reed, Young, Conway,               
Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa, Heitert, Wessels,       
Florida, Baringer, Roddy, Kennedy,               
McMillan, Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd,              
Hanrahan, Bauer, Williamson, Carter,             
Krewson and Mr. President Shrewsbury. 27         
     Noes:0                                      
     Present:0                                   
          THIRD READING                          
        CONSENT CALENDAR                         
      Mr. Wessels moved for third reading and    
final passage of Board Bill Nos. 39 and 40.      
     Seconded by Mr. Heitert.                    
     Carried by the following vote:              
     Ayes: Smith, Flowers, Bosley, Ryan,         
Ford-Griffin, Reed, Young, Conway,               
Ortmann, Vollmer, Villa, Heitert, Wessels,       
Florida, Baringer, Roddy, Kennedy,               
McMillan, Schmid, Jones-King, Boyd,              
Hanrahan, Bauer, Williamson, Carter,             
Krewson and Mr. President Shrewsbury. 27         
     Noes:0                                      
     Present:0                                   
           Board Bill No. 39                     
      An ordinance recommended by the Board      
of Estimate and Apportionment pertaining to      
lead paint remediation projects, appropriating   
from FUND 1116, Cost Center 6200001 in           
Account 5652-Major Projects Services, Two        
Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars                   
($250,000.00) to the Building Division to be     
used to remediate lead paint in approximately    
33 homes which have been identified as needing   
lead remediation, and containing an emergency    
clause.                                          
           Board Bill No. 40                     
      An ordinance authorizing and directing     
the Mayor and Comptroller of the City of St.     
Louis to execute, upon receipt of and in         
consideration of the sum of Five Hundred         
Dollars ($500.00) and other good and valuable    
consideration, a Quit Claim Deed to remise,      
release and forever quit-claim unto Altes, LLC,  
certain City-owned property located in City      
Block 6277, which property is a narrow strip     
of land adjoining River Desperes and             
Chippewa Street, and containing an emergency     
clause.

THE ENGROSSMENT COMMITTEE                        
     AND FINAL PASSAGE                           
       OF BOARD BILLS                            
     None.

 instructed to read same.                          Honorable Fred Heitert, Alderman 12th Ward        
                                                   Honorable Alfred Wessels, Jr., Alderman 13thWard  
            Resolution No. 48                      Honorable Stephen Gregali, Alderman 14th Ward     
       WHEREAS , we have been apprised that        Honorable Jennifer Florida, Alderwoman 15th Ward  
 after more than 26 years of dedicated service     Honorable Donna Baringer, Alderwoman 16th Ward    
 to the City of St. Louis as the Director of       Honorable Joseph Roddy, Alderman 17th Ward        
 Personnel, William C. Duffe retired on            Honorable Terry Kennedy, Alderman 18th Ward       
 April 16, 2004; and                               Honorable Michael McMillan, Alderman 19th Ward    
                                                   Honorable Craig Schmid, Alderman 20th Ward        
       WHEREAS , Bill was born and raised in                                                         
 St. Louis, one of four sons born to Robert and    Honorable Bennice Jones-King, Alderwoman 21st Ward
                                                   Honorable Jeffrey Boyd, Alderman 22nd Ward        
 Mary Duffe, and is a distinguished graduate                                                         
 of the University of Minnesota, St. Louis         Honorable Tom Bauer, Alderman 24th Ward

 University and the University of Missouri;                                                          
                                                   Honorable Gregory J. Carter, Alderman 27th Ward   
 and                                                                                                 
                                                   Honorable Lyda Krewson, Alderwoman 28th Ward      
                                                   Honorable James F. Shrewsbury, President          
           Resolution No. 49                     
      WHEREAS, National Transportation           
Week was created by Congress in May, 1962        
to raise awareness about the importance of       
transportation and to celebrate achievements     
in the field of transportation; and              
     WHEREAS , each year during National         
Transportation Week a day is set aside to        
celebrate women's achievements in                
transportation in the City of St. Louis and to   
encourage girls and young women to pursue        
careers in transportation; and                   
     WHEREAS , women have made                   
significant contributions to the field of        
transportation; and                              
      WHEREAS , we recognize and support         
the need to increase women's participation in    
transportation careers ; and                     
     WHEREAS , this year Tuesday, May            
11, 2004 has been designated as "Women in        
Transportation Day" in the City of St. Louis;    
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our      
deliberations to join in the celebration of      
"Women in Transportation Day" on May 11,         
2004 and we recognize the many outstanding       
contributions women in this community and        
throughout the country have made to the          
improvement of transportation and we further     
direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy  
of this Resolution across the minutes of these   
proceedings and to prepare a commemorative       
copy for presentation to our honorees at a       
time and place deemed appropriate by the         
Sponsor.                                         
Introduced on the 14th day of May, 2004 by:      
Honorable Phyllis Young, Alderwoman 7th Ward     
           Resolution No. 50                     
     WHEREAS, we have been apprised that         
on Saturday, May 15, 2004, the S.S. Samuel       
Parker Chapter of the American Merchant          
Marine and Navy Armed Guard will host a U.       
S. Maritime Dedication Ceremony at Soldiers      
Memorial; and                                    
      WHEREAS , as part of this ceremony,        
Michael Sacco, President of the Seafarers        
International Union of North America, AFL-       
CIO will be honored for his many years of        
outstanding service to the men and women         
serving in the United States Merchant Marine     
both locally and throughout the world; and       
     WHEREAS , Mr. Sacco, who is a native        
of Brooklyn, New York, honorably served this     
country as a member of the United States Air     
Force prior to joining the Seafarers             
International Union in 1958 and shipping         
aboard U.S. flag merchant vessels; and           
       WHEREAS , since the 1960's, Mr. Sacco        
 has served in a variety of union positions,        
 including President of the AFL-CIO Maritime        
 Trades Department; Vice-President of the           
 AFL-CIO; President of the Seafarers                
 International Union; Atlantic, Gulf, Lakes and     
 Inland Waters District/National Maritime           
 Union; and, since 1988, President of the           
 Seafarers International Union of North             
 America, AFL-CIO and                               
       WHEREAS, throughout his career, Mr.          
 Sacco has enjoyed the love and support of his      
 wife, Sophie; his children, Anthony, Valerie,      
 John, Angela and Anne Marie; his fifteen           
 grandchildren and his many friends and             
 admirers throughout the United States;             
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our        
 deliberations to recognize and congratulate        
 Michael Sacco for his many years of service        
 to the 80,000 members of the Seafarers             
 International Union and we thank him for his       
 outstanding commitment to the merchant             
 mariners who play an important role in the         
 growth and development of this country and         
 we further direct the Clerk of this Board to       
 spread a copy of this Resolution across the        
 minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a      
 commemorative copy for presentation to our         
 honoree at a time and place deemed appropriate     
 by the Sponsor.                                    
 Introduced on the 14th day of May, 2004 by:        
 Honorable Stephen Gregali, Alderman 14th Ward      
            Resolution No. 51                       
       WHEREAS, after 37 years of dedicated         
 service to the children of the City of St. Louis,  
 Vera Miller has announced her retirement from      
 the St. Louis Public School System; and            
      WHEREAS, Vera is a distinguished              
 graduate of Southern Illinois University at        
 Edwardsville and began her teaching career in      
 1967 as a teacher's assistant; and                 
      WHEREAS, during her outstanding               
 career as an educator, Vera has taught at Blair    
 Elementary, Grant Middle, Stowe Middle,            
 Clay Elementary and the Special Education          
 Department at Long Middle School; and              
     WHEREAS, Vera is an exceptional                
 member of our community whose                      
 commitment and service to the children of this     
 community is greatly appreciated; and              
      WHEREAS, we are certain that Vera is          
 looking forward to a well deserved retirement      
 with her family and her many friends;              
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our        
 deliberations to recognize and honor Vera        
 Miller on the occasion of her retirement from    
 the St. Louis Public School System and we        
 wish continued peace, happiness and good         
 health and we further direct the Clerk of this   
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution        
 across the minutes of these proceedings and      
 to prepare a commemorative copy for              
 presentation to our honoree at a time and place  
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.               
 Introduced on the 14th day of May, 2004 by:      
 Honorable Alfred Wessels, Alderman 13th Ward     
            Resolution No. 52                     
      WHEREAS, after 32 years of dedicated        
 service to the children of the City of St. Louis,
 Emma Teague has announced her retirement         
 from the St. Louis Public School System; and     
      WHEREAS , Emma is a distinguished           
 graduate of Harris Stowe and Southern Illinois   
 University at Edwardsville and began her         
 teaching career in 1972; and                     
      WHEREAS, during her outstanding             
 career as an educator, Emma has taught at        
 Gundlach Elementary, Emerson Elementary,         
 Enright Middle, Walnut Park Branch,              
 Walbridge Elementary and the Special             
 Education Department at Long Middle              
 School; and                                      
     WHEREAS , Emma is an exceptional             
 member of our community whose                    
 commitment and service to the children of this   
 community is greatly appreciated; and            
       WHEREAS, we are certain that Emma          
 is looking forward to a well deserved retirement 
 with her family and her many friends;            
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize and honor Emma        
 Teague on the occasion of her retirement from    
 the St. Louis Public School System and we        
 wish continued peace, happiness and good         
 health and we further direct the Clerk of this   
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution        
 across the minutes of these proceedings and      
 to prepare a commemorative copy for              
 presentation to our honoree at a time and place  
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.               
 Introduced on the 14th day of May, 2004 by:      
 Honorable Alfred Wessels, Alderman 13th Ward     
            Resolution No. 53                     
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                    
 deliberations to recognize St. Louis County      
 Executive Charlie A. Dooley and acknowledge      
 his many contributions to the St. Louis          
 Metropolitan area; and                           
      WHEREAS , Mr. Dooley is a life long         
resident of St. Louis and, along with his wife,   
Sandra and daughter, Stephanie, attends           
Revelation Missionary Baptist Church; and         
      WHEREAS , after his honorable               
discharge from the United States Army in          
1968, Mr. Dooley went to work as a General        
Service Specialist for McDonnell-Douglas          
Corporation and devoted more than 30 years        
of service prior to his retirement in 1999; and   
     WHEREAS, Mr. Dooley began his                
exceptional political career in 1978 when he      
was elected Alderman for Ward 2 in the City       
of Northwoods; and                                
      WHERAS, prior to his election to the        
St. Louis County Council in 1995, Mr. Dooley      
served as Mayor of the City of Northwoods,        
Democratic Committeeman in Normandy               
Township, President of the Missouri Chapter       
of Black Mayors, President of the St. Louis       
County Municipal League, member of the            
East-West Gateway Coordinating Council's          
Board of Directors and member of the St.          
Louis County Economic Development                 
Council; and                                      
     WHEREAS, on November 4, 2003, after          
serving the residents of the 1st District on the  
St. Louis County Council for almost eight         
years, Mr. Dooley became the first African-       
American to serve as St. Louis County             
Executive, succeeding the late George "Buzz"      
Westfall; and                                     
      WHEREAS, Mr. Dooley is an                   
outstanding member of this community whose        
service and dedication to the residents of St.    
Louis County and to the entire St. Louis region   
is greatly appreciated;                           
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we break from our      
regular agenda to recognize St. Louis County      
Executive Charlie A. Dooley and to thank him      
for his continuing commitment to the growth       
and development of the St. Louis community        
and we direct the Clerk of this Board to spread   
a copy of this Resolution across the minutes      
of these proceedings and to prepare a             
commemorative copy for presentation to our        
honoree at a time and place deemed appropriate    
by the Sponsor.                                   
Introduced on the 14th day of May, 2004 by:       
Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr., Alderman 3rd Ward  
            Resolution No. 54                     
     WHEREAS , The St. Louis Board of             
Aldermen has a long standing tradition of         
supporting and honoring the members of the        
St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department          
who place themselves at substantial risk to       
protect and serve the residents of this           
community; and                                    
      WHEREAS , no member of the St. Louis           
 Police Department deserves our support and          
 respect more than Colonel Joseph J. Mokwa,          
 Chief of Police; and                                
      WHEREAS , every day Colonel Mokwa              
 must address the operational needs of the           
 members of the Police Department as well as         
 the public safety concerns of our citizens and      
 provide a model of leadership that is fair, just    
 and reasonable; and                                 
       WHEREAS, in recent weeks Colonel              
 Mokwa's skills have been more closely               
 scrutinized as a result of the actions of a few     
 officers who failed to follow department            
 policy and procedure and thus placed members        
 of the public in harm's way; and                    
       WHEREAS,           Colonel       Mokwa        
 responded as a responsible Police Chief and         
 true community leader, dealing with the             
 situation quickly, decisively and in the best       
 interest of the citizens he serves; and             
       WHEREAS, Colonel Mokwa is an                  
 outstanding Police Chief and an exceptional         
 member of this community whose dedication           
 to the residents of this City and commitment        
 to their safety is greatly appreciated;             
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our          
 deliberations to recognize and commend              
 Colonel Joseph J. Mokwa for his dedication          
 to duty and we thank him, on behalf of the          
 citizens of the City of St. Louis, for his service  
 to this community and we direct the Clerk of        
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution      
 across the minutes of these proceedings and         
 to further prepare a commemorative copy to          
 the end that it may be presented to our honoree     
 at a time and place deemed appropriate by           
 the Sponsor.                                        
 Introduced on the 14th day of May, 2004 by:         
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr., Alderman 3rd Ward    
      Unanimous consent having been                  
 obtained Resolution Nos. 48-54 stood                
 considered.                                         
      Mr. President Shrewsbury moved that            
 Resolution Nos. 48-54 be adopted, at this           
 meeting of the Board.                               
       Seconded by Mr. Villa.                        
       Carried unanimously by voice vote.            
              FIRST READING                          
             OF RESOLUTIONS                          
       None.                                         
            SECOND READING                           
            OF RESOLUTIONS                           
       None.                                         
       MISCELLANEOUS AND                      
       UNFINISHED BUSINESS                    
      None.                                   
           ANNOUNCEMENTS                      
      None.                                   
         EXCUSED ALDERMEN                     
      All members were present.               
              ADJOURNMENT                     
      Mr. Wessels moved to adjourn under      
 rules to return Friday, May 21, 2004.        
      Seconded by Mr. Villa.                  
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
      Respectfully submitted,                 
      Karen L. Divis, Clerk                   
      Board of Aldermen                       
   BOARD OF                                   
 PUBLIC SERVICE                               
         REGULAR MEETING                      
    St. Louis, MO - May 18, 2004              
      Board met at 1:45 P.M.                  
     Present:    Directors Visintainer,       
 Suelmann, Siedhoff, Simon and President      
 Hearst.                                      
      Absent: Directors Bess, Moore and       
 Griggs. (excused)                            
      Requests of the Director of Parks,      
 Recreation and Forestry; Director of Health  
 and Hospitals, and; Director of Airport to be
 excused from the Regular Meeting of          
 May 18, 2004 were received and leaves of     
 absence granted.                             
     Minutes of the Regular Meeting of        
 May 11, 2004 were unanimously approved.      
      The following documents were referred   
 by the Secretary:                            
               May 14, 2004                   
      To the Director of Streets: Petition No.
 6605, LRA & Keith B. Edwards, vacate b/t     
 23rd and 25th and alley to the south of 2300-
 2346 Sullivan in C.B. 1087-N and 1088;       
 108761, DA's Restaurant, encroach with       
 sidewalk cafe at 900 Walnut.                 
      To the Directors of Health and Hospitals
 and Public Safety: 108762, New Northside     
 Child Development Center, conduct day care   
 center at 5939 Goodfellow; 108763, Faith     
 Infant Toddler Center, Inc., conduct day care
 center at 8209 N. Broadway; 108764, Genesis  
 Developmental Child Care, Inc., conduct day  
 care center at 7901 N. Broadway.             
               May 17, 2004                        
      To the Director of Streets: 108765, Hope     
United Church of Christ, hang 10 banners on        
light standards on Tamm and Eichelberger           
           H EARING HELD -                         
          ACTION DEFERRED                          
      The decision on Hearing No. 8058 -           
Consideration of revocation of Conditional         
Use Permit No. 103745, Titanic Coffee Shop,        
LLC, occupy 4632 Gravois as a coffee house,        
for violation of Condition No. 3, "no selling      
of liquor," ordered postponed for a period of      
one week pending consultation with our             
attorney.                                          
     Communications, reports, recommend-           
ations and documents were submitted by             
Board Members and action thereon taken as          
follows:                                           
                PRESIDENT                          
     Preliminary approval ordered given and        
10 days granted in which to sign same:             
     Letting No. 8250 - Construction of the        
Forest Park Parkway, DeBaliviere to                
Kingshighway, Gaines Construction, Inc.,           
329 Josephville, Road, Wentzville, MO              
63385, Amount: $2,767,820.86.                      
     Addendum No. 1 to Letting No. 8252 -          
2003 Window Film Installation at the Main          
Terminal and East Terminal at Lambert              
approved and made part of the original plans.      
      Supplemental Agreement No. 5 to              
P.S.A. No. 926 with BM & ABNA (Joint               
Venture) for Overpass, Ramps and Interchange       
at Lambert approved and President authorized       
to execute same.                                   
     Supplemental Agreement No. 5 to               
P.S.A. 955 with HDR Engineering, Inc., for         
Design Services for North Roads at Lambert         
approved and President authorized to execute       
same.                                              
      Supplemental Agreement No. 8 to P.S.A.       
No. 974 with URS Corp., for Design of New          
Runway 12R-30L Complex and                         
Modifications of Existing Electrical               
Distribution System at Lambert approved and        
President authorized to execute same.              
     Board declared as emergency installation      
of Sediment Containment Storm Water                
Treatment System Chamber at Lambert.

PUBLIC UTILITIES AND STREETS

Corporation, alley dedication plat to provide      
for a continuation of existing ingress and egress  
between Salzburger and Quincy that would           
otherwise be extinguished by alley vacation        
plat, C.B. 4699-N ordered approved, subject        
to certain conditions.

       UTILITIES AND STREETS

   REQUEST FOR                                  
  QUALIFICATIONS                                
       CITY OF ST. LOUIS                        
    BOARD OF PUBLIC SERVICE                     
      The City of St. Louis invites interested  
 firms to submit Statement of Qualifications    
 (SOQ) to provide DESIGN/BUILD                  
 SERVICES         FOR         NEW         AIR   
 CONDITIONING            SYSTEM           AT    
 STEINBERG SKATING RINK BUILDING                
 IN FOREST PARK, ST. LOUIS,                     
 MISSOURI.                                      
       The City of St. Louis has established a  
 M/WBE participation goal of 25% and 5%         
 for this project.                              
      The Request for Qualifications package    
 may be obtained from BPS website               
 www.stlbps.org under Contracts & Bids,         
 Professional Services; by picking the RFQ up   
 at Board of Public Service, 1200 Market Street,
 Room 301 City Hall, St. Louis, MO 63103;       
 or by calling Bette Behan at 314-589-6214      
 during the hours of 8am-5pm commencing         
 April 30, 2004.                                
       Statements of Qualifications will be     
 received no later than 5:00 p.m., Thursday,    
 May 20, 2004, at BPS at the same address as    
 listed above.                                  
       The Board of Public Service reserves the 
 right to accept or reject any or all responses,
 or to cancel this request in part or in its    
 entirety.
